About Us

Get Involved (Call to action)

Camrose Neighbor Aid Center began as a collaboration between six evangelical churches and has grown into a network supported by 20 local churches. Our mission is rooted in faith and service, ensuring that no one in our community goes without basic needs.

Our Vision

A community where everyone's basic needs are met through Christ-centered service and support.

Our Logo

Our Beliefs

Our Values

Our Team

Meet the dedicated individuals who work tirelessly to serve our community.

Sarah Thompson

Executive Director

Sarah brings over 15 years of nonprofit leadership experience and a passion for community service.

Michael Chen

Program Coordinator

Michael oversees our food bank and transportation services, ensuring smooth operations and maximum impact.

Emily Rodriguez

Volunteer Manager

Emily coordinates our dedicated volunteer network and develops training programs for new volunteers.

David Wilson

Community Outreach

David builds partnerships with local organizations and manages our community engagement initiatives.

Grace Anderson

Administrative Coordinator

Grace ensures smooth daily operations and provides crucial support to our team and clients.

Join Our Mission

Together, we can make a difference in our community. Join us as a volunteer or support our mission through donations.
